intro: Cryptophoranthus minimus, commonly known as the dwarf cryptophoranthus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
